result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn P. Bauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Pepin County Case No. 2015CF20.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs/surcharges according to a schedule as set forth by Probation & Parole.

Provide a DNA sample.
No possession or consumption of alcohol.
Comply with any assessment or counseling required by Probation & Parole.

supervisions.notes: To be paid in installments of $150.00 per month commencing 03-01-2016 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full.

Serve 65 days in the Pepin County Jail commencing immediately with credit for 3 days served.  The first 48 hours without release considered as part of the 3 days served.  Work release privileges granted.
AMENDED 02-22-2016:  4 hours per week granted for child care.
Operating privileges revoked for a period of 24 months with credit for any administrative suspension.

Operator's license IID effective date of application.
Vehicle IID effective 45 days from 02-16-2016.
Submit to and comply with an alcohol assessment by the approved public treatment facility and comply with the development of a driver safety plan.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 17R 000261 - Balance owing on Count 2 paid in full.
Letter to defendant advising of seven days to pay or warrant will be issued.
Order for Ignition Interlock Exemption of 2002 Hyundai.
16R 000859.  Shawn's mother came in with a payment of $150 for Shawn and will pay $300 next friday.
Letter to defendant advising of seven days to pay or warrant will be issued.

Defendant Shawn P. Bauer in court with attorney Aaron Olson in 15CF48.  Defendant  Shawn P. Bauer in court with Attorney Joseph Randke in 15CF20.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel received PSI, no corrections.  State recommends 3 yrs probation, 6 mos. jail as condition of probation, consecutive jail sentence.  Atty Randke recommends 2-3 yrs. probation, conditional jail be stayed, if confinement ordered, ask huber and time with kids.  Atty Olson objects to conditional jail, probation appropriate.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 3 yrs. probation with conditions.
Letter from MB regarding sentencing of Shawn Bauer.
NOH mailed to Shawn P. Bauer, 513 E Montgomery Street, Durand, WI 54736 ret'd to sender
Sentencing hearing on April 25, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Letter from defendant requesting child care.

Defendant Shawn P. Bauer in court with attorney Aaron Olson.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached.  Defendant will plead to count 1 in 15CF20, count 1 & 2 in 15CF48 and count 3 will be DRI.  State w/draws motion to revoke bond & forfeit bail; PSI requested and proceed on OWI today.  Court advises defendant of count 1 in 15CF20, defendant pleads guilty; advised of charges of count 1 & 2 in 15CF48, defendant pleads guilty to each count.  Plea colloquy.  Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights & plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 in 15CF48, sentence to fine/costs of $1744.00; 65 days jail with credit for 3 days served; 48 hours w/o work release considered as part of 3 days already served; work release privileges; immediately report; revoke operating privileges for 24 mos.; AA & DSP; 12 mos. IID; IID on vehicle eff. 45 days from today;  PSI ordered on count 1 in 15CF20 & count 1 in 15CF48; referred to scheduling clerk for sentencing date @ 45 days out; Count 3 in 15CF48 DRI; all other counts and cases dismissed.

Status conference at 02-16-2016 02:30 pm.
Motion hearing at 02-16-2016 02:30 pm.
Motion to Revoke Bond and Forfeit Bail

Attorney Aaron Olson in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant f/t/a.  Matter set for STC.  Counsel to reschedule to date set on other cases 2/16.  Atty Olson scheduled in another county.  Counsel may reschedule if reaches his client or may appear by phone on 2/16.  Status conference scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Shawn P. Bauer in court with attorney Aaron Olson.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charges as stated in the Amended Information, maximum penalties.  NGP entered.  Referred to scheduling clerk.

Defendant Shawn P. Bauer in court with attorney Aaron Olson.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charges as stated in the Information, maximum penalties, and advises defendant of constitutional rights.  NGP entered.  Any conditions of bond if any cont'd.  Status conference scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Cash bond amended to Signature Bond.
Cooperate and pay for random drug testing as requested by Pepin County Sheriff's Dept.

Atty Randtke requests to address bond.  Defendant posted $1000 cash, this matter did not happen after he posted, request $1000 cash bond.  Court reviews files and timeline and confirms these violations did not occur after he posted, happened while he was on a signature bond.  State does not oppose $1000 cash bond with conditions listed on previous bond conditions.  Court modifies bond to $3000 Signature Bond on this case with conditions:  cooperate and pay for random drug testing as requested by Pepin County Sheriff's Dept.  Dist. Atty to prepare the bond and have defendant sign today.

Defendant Shawn P. Bauer in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Defendant Shawn P. Bauer in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Officer Peter Pillman Sworn & testifies.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial, instruct the DA to file the Information.  Atty Randtke to contact scheduling clerk to set hrg. on arraignment.
P.P. required to appear on 10/08/2015 at 4:00 pm

Defendant Shawn P. Bauer in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charges/max. penalties, felony prohibitions if convicted.  Advised of constitutional rights.  He's sitting on $1000 cash bond, no bond on earlier cases, there's $1000 cash bond sitting there and now a new violation.  State won't request an increase cash bond, he's represented, he's local.  Court notes cash bond can be considered after a bond has been a violation.  I'm like to impose an addt'l cash bond.  Atty Randtke asks at this bond to leave the bond as is.  Court concerned with bail jumping charge with violation date in July, cash bond was set on that charge and then a new bail jumping case in September violation alleges continued use of controlled substance, it involves a use of motor vehicles with at least a detectable amount of that controlled substance which poses a direct risk to public; $1000 cash bond not sufficient, set addt'l cash bond of $3000 in addition to the $1000 that is posted.  The state will consider whether to revoke the $1000 cash bond.  You are remitted to PCSD until bond is posted.   Mr. Randtke requests P.H.  Referred to scheduling clerk.
